isis.stitle: TSI 01-12-02 - Extension Tube For Road Draft Exhaust Opening

subjectgroup.subject: Extension Tube For Road Draft Exhaust Opening

geninfo.para: The open end position of the road draft tube promotes oil laden vapor to collect and condense on the engine/pan interface surfaces. The oil is also drawn into the flywheel housing through the channel in the lower center portion. This causes the oil to pool on the inner lower bell housing, making it look like a rear seal or oil pan gasket leak.

To prevent oil from condensing in this area, a 9½ inch extension tube
is fastened to the road draft tube to vent oil laden vapor away from the engine.

note.para: To prevent collection of oil residue on exhaust components, do not install hose such that it discharges directly towards any part of exhaust system. The extension tube will result in a cleaner lower engine area and improve diagnostic capability should a leak exist.

figure.caption: Figure 1. 9½ inch Extension Tube Attached To Engine

calloutgroup.callout1: A. 9½ inch extension tube positioned away from engine

item.para: Attach the hose to the road draft tube with a 13/16 - 1¾ hose clamp.
Be sure to angle tube away from critical engine components.

note.para: Before changing rear seal, install extension tube. Monitor area for 30 - 60 days, return if condition persists. Following this procedure will allow for the proper identification of other possible conditions.
